TEXT.TITLE: STATOIL AWARDS VESLEFRIKK OIL FIELD CONTRACTS
TEXT.BODY: Norwegian state oil company Den Norske Stats Oljeselskap (Statoil) signed contracts worth a total of 1.5 billion Norwegian crowns in connection with the development of the Veslefrikk oil field, Statoil said. Moss Rosenberg Verft of Stavanger has been awarded a contract to convert the the drilling platform West Vision to a floating production platform. The work is to be completed in the summer of 1989. Aker Verdal has been awarded a contract for the engineering, purchasing and construction of the steel jacket for the wellhead platform, also to be completed in 1989, Statoil said. Reuter
